lines.text: x CM = x position of center of mass, m 1 = mass of object 1, x 1 = x position of object 1, m 2 = mass of object 2, x 2 = x position of object 2

secText: This section’s equation lets you calculate the location of the center of mass along a single axis, of a system of small objects, when you know the locations and masses of the individual objects.

To find the system’s center of mass, you multiply the mass of each object by its x-position, sum the results, and then divide by the sum of the masses. We show the equation for the first two masses, but it works for as many masses and positions that make up the system of objects.
